tasting_note: Floral with notes of banana, green apple, lychee, pear, spice and almonds. Elegant, dry and complex with great replays and a fine acidity. Good balance and quite delicious. (VINTAGES panel, July 2014)

name: Rihaku Dreamy Clouds Tokubetsu Junmai Nigori Sake
tags: rihaku dreamy clouds tokubetsu junmai nigori sake beer specialty japan vine connections bottle
description: Gold Medal and Category Winner at the 2014 Toronto International Sake Challenge.
tasting_note: Nigori Sakes are filtered using a coarse meshed cloth or net. This does not remove all of the particles in the Sake and results in the cloudiness you see here. Notes of plum, melon, apple, tropical fruits and lemon citrus on the nose. A pleasing sweetness on the creamy, textured palate and good complexity and depth of flavour. A long finish. Shake well before opening. (VINTAGES panel, July 2014)

name: Momokawa G Joy Junmai Ginjo Genshu
tags: momokawa g joy junmai ginjo genshu beer specialty usa oregon sakeone corporation bottle
tasting_note: Genshu is one of the driest styles of sake. This one has a very pale straw colour. The aromas suggest pea pods, mango, seashore, pear and lychee. Dry, with an intriguing mix of earthy tones and fruit. Quite full-flavoured and complex, with crisp acidity keeping things refreshing to the finish. The alcohol level (18% by vol.) is wonderfully integrated and barely detectable on the palate. (VINTAGES panel, June 2012)
